TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Assignment extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientObject

Docs.summary: Contains the common properties for draft assignments and published assignments.

remarks.para: The DraftAssignment class and the PublishedAssignment class are derived from the Assignment class. All of the properties in the Assignment class are read-only. To set the value of assignment properties, use a DraftAssignment object.
For more information about fields in Microsoft Project 2013, see Available fields reference

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientRuntimeContext context, class Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ObjectPath objectPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The client run-time context for using remote objects.
The path of the object in the client context.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the Assignment class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ActualCostWorkPerformed As Double
public: property double ActualCostWorkPerformed { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the actual cost of work performed (ACWP) for the assignment to date.
Docs.value: The value of the ACWP.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ActualOvertimeCost As Double
public: property double ActualOvertimeCost { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the actual overtime cost for the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the overtime cost.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BaselineCost As Double
public: property double BaselineCost { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total planned costs of the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the baseline cost.

remarks.para: Baseline Cost = (Work * Standard Rate) + (Overtime Work * Overtime Rate) + Per Use Cost

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BaselineCostPerUse As Double
public: property double BaselineCostPerUse { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the cost per use of a resource on an assignment, at the time of the project baseline.
Docs.value: The value of the baseline cost per use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BaselineFinish As DateTime
public: property DateTime BaselineFinish { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the planned completion date for an assignment, at the time of the project baseline.
Docs.value: The planned completion date.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BaselineStart As DateTime
public: property DateTime BaselineStart { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the planned start date for an assignment, at the time of the project baseline.
Docs.value: The planned start date.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BaselineWork As String
public: property System::String ^ BaselineWork { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets total planned person-hours scheduled for an assignment, at the time of the project baseline.
Docs.value: The total planned hours.

remarks.para: To get the TimeSpan value for the baseline work, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BaselineWorkTimeSpan As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan BaselineWorkTimeSpan { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total time interval of planned person-hours scheduled for an assignment, at the time of the project baseline.
Docs.value: The total planned hours.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BudgetedCostWorkPerformed As Double
public: property double BudgetedCostWorkPerformed { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the budgeted cost of work performed (BCWP).
Docs.value: The value of the BCWP.

remarks.para: BCWP is the cumulative value of percent complete, multiplied by the timephased baseline costs. It is calculated up to the status date or today's date. BCWP is also known as earned value (EV).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BudgetedCostWorkScheduled As Double
public: property double BudgetedCostWorkScheduled { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the budgeted cost of work scheduled (BCWS) for the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the BCWS.

remarks.para: The BCWS is the sum of the timephased baseline costs of an assignment, up to the status date or today's date.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CostVariance As Double
public: property double CostVariance { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the cost variance (CV), which is the difference between the baseline cost and the total cost of the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the CV.

remarks.para: Cost variance is the difference between the budgeted cost of work performed and the actual cost of work performed for the assignment, as in the following equation:
CV = BCWP - ACWP

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CostVarianceAtCompletion As Double
public: property double CostVarianceAtCompletion { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the cost variance at completion (VAC) for the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the VAC.

remarks.para: VAC = (Budgeted at completion) – (Estimated at completion)
The budgeted at completion cost is the baseline cost.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Created As DateTime
public: property DateTime Created { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the date when the assignment was created.
Docs.value: The date of creation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentCostVariance As Double
public: property double CurrentCostVariance { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current cost variance (CV).
Docs.value: The value of the current CV.

remarks.para: The current earned value CV shows the difference between how much it should have cost and how much it has actually cost to achieve the current level of completion, up to the status date or today's date.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CustomFields As CustomFieldCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of custom fields for the assignment.
Docs.value: The custom field collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FinishVariance As String
public: property System::String ^ FinishVariance { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the variance of the finish date of the assignment.
Docs.value: The duration of the finish variance. For example, 2d (two days) or 3w (three weeks).

remarks.para: The finish variance is the difference between the baseline finish date and the current finish date of the assignment, as in the following formula:
Finish Variance = Finish – Baseline Finish
To get the TimeSpan value for the finish variance, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FinishVarianceTimeSpan As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan FinishVarianceTimeSpan { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time interval for the variance of the finish date of the assignment.
Docs.value: The duration of the finish variance.

remarks.para: The finish variance is the difference between the baseline finish date and the current finish date of the assignment, as in the following formula:
Finish Variance = Finish – Baseline Finish

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Id As Guid
public: property Guid Id { Guid get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the GUID of the assignment.
Docs.value: The unique identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override bool InitOnePropertyFromJson (string peekedName, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.JsonReader reader);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool InitOnePropertyFromJson(string peekedName, class Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.JsonReader reader) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function InitOnePropertyFromJson (peekedName As String, reader As JsonReader) As Boolean
protected: override bool InitOnePropertyFromJson(System::String ^ peekedName, Microsoft::SharePoint::Client::JsonReader ^ reader);

Docs.param: The name of the property to initialize.
The JsonReader object that initializes the property value from the JSON data.
Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsConfirmed As Boolean
public: property bool IsConfirmed { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that shows whether the resource has accepted the assignment.
Docs.value: True if the assignment is confirmed; otherwise, False.

remarks.para: When an assignment is created, Project Server sets the IsConfirmed value to False. When the project manager sends an assignment update to a resource, Project Server sets the IsResponsePending value to True. If the resource accepts the assignment, the IsResponsePending value is set to False and the IsConfirmed value is set to True.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsOverAllocated As Boolean
public: property bool IsOverAllocated { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the resource is overallocated during the time of the assignment.
Docs.value: True if the resource is overallocated; otherwise, False.

remarks.para: An overallocated resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal working capacity. The work capacity of a resource is determined by the resource calendar and the resource availability during the assignment.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsPublished As Boolean
public: property bool IsPublished { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the assignment is published.
Docs.value: True if the assignment is published; otherwise, False.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsResponsePending As Boolean
public: property bool IsResponsePending { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that shows whether the assignment update has been sent to the resource.
Docs.value: True if the assignment update is sent to the resource; otherwise, False.

remarks.para: When an assignment is created, Project Server sets the IsConfirmed value to False. When the project manager sends an assignment update to a resource, Project Server sets the IsResponsePending value to True. If the resource accepts the assignment, the IsResponsePending value is set to False and the IsConfirmed value is set to True.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsUpdateNeeded As Boolean
public: property bool IsUpdateNeeded { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an assignment update should be sent to the resource.
Docs.value: True if the assignment needs an update; otherwise, False.

remarks.para: When a scheduled task changes start date, finish date, or duration, Project Server sets IsUpdateNeeded to True if the scheduling change affects the assignment.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LevelingDelay As String
public: property System::String ^ LevelingDelay { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the amount of time that resource leveling can delay the assignment from its early start date.
Docs.value: The duration of the leveling delay. For example, 2d (two days) or 3w (three weeks).To get the TimeSpan value for the leveling delay, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LevelingDelayTimeSpan As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan LevelingDelayTimeSpan { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time interval for the amount of time that resource leveling can delay the assignment from its early start date.
Docs.value: The duration of the leveling delay.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Modified As DateTime
public: property DateTime Modified { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the date when the assignment was modified.
Docs.value: The date of modification.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OvertimeCost As Double
public: property double OvertimeCost { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total overtime cost of the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the overtime cost.

remarks.para: Overtime Cost = Actual Overtime Cost + Remaining Overtime Cost

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RemainingCost As Double
public: property double RemainingCost { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total remaining cost of the assignment, as scheduled.
Docs.value: The value of the remaining cost.

remarks.para: Remaining Cost = (Remaining Work * Standard Rate) + Remaining Overtime Cost

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RemainingOvertimeCost As Double
public: property double RemainingOvertimeCost { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the scheduled remaining overtime cost of the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the remaining overtime cost.

remarks.para: Remaining Overtime Cost = Overtime Cost - Actual Overtime Cost

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Resume As DateTime
public: property DateTime Resume { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the date and time when a resource resumes work on the assignment.
Docs.value: The date when the resource resumes work.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ScheduleCostVariance As Double
public: property double ScheduleCostVariance { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the schedule cost variance (CV), which is the difference between the baseline cost and the scheduled cost of the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the schedule cost variance.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Start As DateTime
public: property DateTime Start { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the date and time that a resource is scheduled to start the assignment.
Docs.value: The assignment start date.

remarks.para: Project calculates the assignment start date based on the resource calendar and task dependencies. It also considers the task start date and any assignment delay, as follows:
Assignment Start = Task Start + Assignment Delay

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StartVariance As String
public: property System::String ^ StartVariance { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the variance of the assignment start date.
Docs.value: The duration of the start variance. For example, 2d (two days) or 3w (three weeks).

remarks.para: The start variance is the difference between the baseline start date of the assignment and the currently scheduled start date, as in the following formula:
Start Variance = Start – Baseline Start
To get the TimeSpan value for the start variance, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StartVarianceTimeSpan As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan StartVarianceTimeSpan { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time interval for the variance of the assignment start date.
Docs.value: The duration of the start variance.

remarks.para: The start variance is the difference between the baseline start date of the assignment and the currently scheduled start date, as in the following formula:
Start Variance = Start – Baseline Start

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Stop As DateTime
public: property DateTime Stop { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the date and time when a resource stops work on the assignment.
Docs.value: The stop date.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WorkVariance As String
public: property System::String ^ WorkVariance { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the difference between baseline work and currently scheduled work on the assignment.
Docs.value: The value of the work variance.

remarks.para: Work Variance = Work - Baseline Work
To get the TimeSpan value for the work variance, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WorkVarianceTimeSpan As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan WorkVarianceTimeSpan { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time interval for the difference between baseline work and currently scheduled work on the assignment.
Docs.value: The duration of the work variance.

remarks.para: Work Variance = Work - Baseline Work
